snippet: In 2007, Barack Obama described a surveillance state run amok. He is now the leader of a surveillance state that some of his own advisers think has gotten out of control.
abstract: Pres Obama, as a young lawmaker, vowed to rein in a surveillance state run amok and now he presides over a surveillance state that some of his advisers think is once again out of control; his speech at Justice Dept will defend government spying even as he adjusts it to address wave of public concern over civil liberties.
lead_paragraph: In 2007, Barack Obama described a surveillance state run amok. He is now the leader of a surveillance state that some of his own advisers think has gotten out of control.

headline.main: Obama’s Path From Critic to Overseer of Spying
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Path From Critic to Overseer of Spying
